org.vanilladb.core.storage.file

Class FileMgr

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.vanilladb.core.storage.file.FileMgr

  • public class FileMgr
extends Object
    The VanillaDb file manager. The database system stores its data as files within a specified directory. The file manager provides methods for reading the contents of a file block to a Java byte buffer, writing the contents of a byte buffer to a file block, and appending the contents of a byte buffer to the end of a file. These methods are called exclusively by the class Page, and are thus package-private. The class also contains two public methods: Method isNew is called during system initialization by VanillaDb.init(java.lang.String). Method size is called by the log manager and transaction manager to determine the end of the file.

    • Constructor Detail

      • FileMgr

        public FileMgr(String dbName)
        Creates a file manager for the specified database. The database will be stored in a folder of that name in the user's home directory. If the folder does not exist, then a folder containing an empty database is created automatically. Files for all temporary tables (i.e. tables beginning with "_temp") will be deleted during initializing.
        Parameters:
        dbName - the name of the directory that holds the database

    • Method Detail

      • size

        public long size(String fileName)
        Returns the number of blocks in the specified file.
        Parameters:
        fileName - the name of the file
        Returns:
        the number of blocks in the file

      • isFileEmpty

        public boolean isFileEmpty(String fileName)
        Returns true if a file is empty, else false.

        Side Effect: These method has cache mechanism. If the file is no longer empty, isFileEmpty will always return false unless restarting the database.
        Parameters:
        fileName - the name of the file
        Returns:
        whether a file is empty or not

      • isNew

        public boolean isNew()
        Returns a boolean indicating whether the file manager had to create a new database directory.
        Returns:
        true if the database is new

      • delete

        public void delete(String fileName)
        Delete the specified file.
        Parameters:
        fileName - the name of the target file
